&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Goodwill recognized&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;26%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:26.2%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 747,976 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;73%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:73.8%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Equity&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;26%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:26.2%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,047,976 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Following completion of the acquisition and integration of the GE HRS into our business, on November 13, 2015 we changed our name to &amp;#147;Clean Energy Technologies, Inc.&amp;#148; to better reflect the focus of our new business and business strategies. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Previously, in March 2013, we acquired 100% of the issued and outstanding common stock of Trident Manufacturing, Inc., a Utah corporation engaged in electronics manufacturing services focused on industrial, aerospace, military, instrumentation, and medical markets, in exchange for 1,600,000 restricted shares of our common stock. &amp;#160;As of the Trident acquisition, we recognized $420,673 in goodwill.&amp;#160; For the year ended December 31, 2015, we impaired the goodwill in the amount of $420,673.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;b&gt; &lt;/b&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Going Concern&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The financial statements have been prepared on a going concern basis, which contemplates continuity of operations, realization of assets and liquidation of liabilities in the normal course of business. The Company had a total stockholder&amp;#146;s deficit of $2,268,254 and a working capital deficit of $3,307,374 and a net loss of $1,699,726 for the year ended December 31, 2016. The company also had an accumulated deficit of $6,574,864 as of December 31, 2016 and used $513,186 in net cash from operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2016. Therefore, there is substantial doubt about the ability of the Company to continue as a going concern. There can be no assurance that the Company will achieve its goals and reach a profitable operating stand and is still dependent upon its ability (1) to obtain sufficient debt and/or equity capital and/or (2) to generate positive cash flow from operations.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;Plan of Operation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;Management is taking the following steps to sustain profitability and growth: (i) &lt;/font&gt;pursuing &lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;increase&lt;/font&gt;d&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt; sa&lt;/font&gt;le&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;s through existing global distribution channels and utilization of direct sales&lt;/font&gt;;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt; (ii) &lt;/font&gt;pursuing lease and energy-based contracts with customers, including targeted island or isolated locations where the economics, energy production, and emissions reduction profiles are attractive; (iii) pursuing stable and higher-margin electronics manufacturing services contracts where the terms are favorable to the Company; (iv) arranging financing partnerships and relationships to facilitate increased lease and energy-based commercialization of our HRS products; (v) &lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;leveraging core competencies to acquire &lt;/font&gt;or integrate other &lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;technologies and entertain equity opportunities&lt;/font&gt;;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt; and (&lt;/font&gt;vi&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;) &lt;/font&gt;pursuing &lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;license&lt;/font&gt;s of our &lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;patented technology and proprietary process&lt;/font&gt;es&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt; and develop&lt;/font&gt;ing&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt; cogeneration and OEM opportunities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;Our future success is likely dependent on our ability to sustain profitable growth and attain additional capital to support growth. There can be no assurance that we will be successful in obtaining any such financing, or that it will be able to generate sufficient positive cash flow from operations. &amp;nbsp;The successful outcome of these or any future activities cannot be determined at this time and there is no assurance that if achieved, we will have sufficient funds to execute its business plans. The financial statements do not include any adjustments relating to the recoverability and classification of asset carrying amounts or the amount and classification of liabilities that might result should we be unable to continue as a going concern. &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Our Products and Services &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;Our main product, the Clean Cycle HRS system, converts heat from variety of heat sources into clean, affordable electricity. Our heat recovery solution system generates electricity from heat with zero additional fuel required, zero additional emissions produced, and low maintenance.&amp;#160; The Clean Cycle HRS system is also re-deployable with continuous 24x7 operation.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Sales and Marketing &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Our marketing approach is to position the Company, our products and our services under our new &amp;#147;Clean Energy Technologies, Inc.&amp;#148; and &amp;#147;CETY&amp;#148; identity and brand.&amp;#160; We intend to market our Heat Recovery Solutions products specifically using the market-recognized Clean Cycle brand name.&amp;#160; We also intend to utilize our relationships to identify new market segments and regions in which we can expand the commercialization of our products.&amp;#160; We intend to offer our products for sale and also to commercialize them under leases, energy-based contracts and other financing structures to accelerate customer adoption and increase market penetration.&amp;#160; We also intend to explore licensing opportunities for our patented and other proprietary technologies. We utilize both direct sales force and global distributors with expertise in clean energy. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Corporate Information &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We were originally incorporated in California in July 1995 under the name Probe Manufacturing Industries, Inc.&amp;nbsp; We reincorporated in Nevada in April 2005 under the name Probe Manufacturing, Inc.&amp;nbsp; In November 2015, following our acquisition of heat recovery solutions assets from General Electric, we changed our name to Clean Energy Technologies, Inc.&amp;nbsp; Our principal executive offices are located at 2990 Redhill Avenue, Costa Mesa, CA 92626.&amp;nbsp; Our telephone number is (949) 273-4990.&amp;nbsp; Our common stock is listed on the OTC Market Group&amp;#146;s Pink Open Market under the symbol &amp;#147;CETY.&amp;#148;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Our internet website address is www.cetyinc.com.&amp;nbsp; The information contained on our website is not incorporated by reference into this document, and you should not consider any information contained on, or that can be accessed through, our website as part of this document. &amp;nbsp; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 &amp;#150; BASIS OF PRESENTATION AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;The summary of significant accounting policies of Clean Energy Technologies, Inc. (formerly Probe Manufacturing, Inc.) is presented to assist in the understanding of the Company&apos;s financial statements.&amp;#160; The financial statements and notes are representations of the Company&amp;#146;s management, who is responsible for their integrity and objectivity.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Such estimates may be materially different from actual financial results. Significant estimates include the recoverability of long-lived assets, the collection of accounts receivable and valuation of inventory and reserves.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We maintain the majority of our cash accounts at a commercial bank. The total cash balance is insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (&amp;#147;FDIC&amp;#148;) up to $250,000 per commercial bank. For purposes of the statement of cash flows we consider all cash and highly liquid investments with initial maturities of one year or less to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Accounts Receivable&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We grant credit to our customers located within the United States of America; and do not require collateral. Our ability to collect receivables is affected by economic fluctuations in the geographic areas and industries served by us. &amp;nbsp;Reserves for un-collectable amounts are provided, based on past experience and a specific analysis of the accounts.&amp;nbsp; Although we expect to collect amounts due, actual collections may differ from the estimated amounts. As of December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016, we had a reserve for potentially un-collectable accounts of $7,000.&amp;nbsp; Five (5) customers accounted for approximately 96% of accounts receivable at December 31, 2016. Our trade accounts primarily represent unsecured receivables.&amp;nbsp; Historically, our bad debt write-offs related to these trade accounts have been insignificant.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Inventory&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Inventories are valued at the lower of weighted average cost or market value. Our industry experiences changes in technology, changes in market value and availability of raw materials, as well as changing customer demand. We make provisions for estimated excess and obsolete inventories based on regular audits and cycle counts of our on-hand inventory levels and forecasted customer demands and at times additional provisions are made. Any inventory write offs are charged to the reserve account. As of December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015, we had a reserve for potentially obsolete inventory of $250,000.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property and Equipment &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Property and equipment are recorded at cost. Assets held under capital leases are recorded at lease inception at the lower of the present value of the minimum lease payments or the fair market value of the related assets.&amp;nbsp; The cost of ordinary maintenance and repairs is charged to operations. Depreciation and amortization are computed on the straight-line method over the following estimated useful lives of the related assets:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; Furniture and fixtures&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; 3 to 7 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; Equipment&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; 7 to 10 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Long &amp;#150;Lived Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Our management assesses the recoverability of its long-lived assets by determining whether the depreciation and amortization of long lived assets over their remaining lives can be recovered through projected undiscounted future cash flows. The amount of long-lived asset impairment if any, is measured based on fair value and is charged to operations in the period in which long-lived assets impairment is determined by management. There can be no assurance however, that market conditions will not change or demand for our services will continue, which could result in impairment of long-lived assets in the future.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Revenue from product and services are recognized at the time goods are shipped or services are provided to the customer, with an appropriate provision for returns and allowances. Terms are generally FOB origination with the right of inspection and acceptance. We have not experienced a material amount of rejected or damaged product.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company provides services for its customers that range from contract design to original product design to repair services. The Company recognizes service revenue when the services have been performed, and the related costs are expensed as incurred.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The carrying amount of accounts payable and accrued expenses are considered to be representative of their respective fair values because of the short-term nature of these financial instruments. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Other Comprehensive Income&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We have no material components of other comprehensive income (loss) and accordingly, net loss is equal to comprehensive loss in all periods.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Net Profit (Loss) per Common Share&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Basic profit / (loss) per share is computed on the basis of the weighted average number of common shares outstanding.&amp;nbsp; At December 31, 2016, we had outstanding common shares of 155,178,083 used in the calculation of basic earnings per share.&amp;nbsp; Basic Weighted average common shares and equivalents at December 31, 2016 and 2015 were 142,572,730 and 59,583,060, respectively.&amp;nbsp; As of December 31, 2016, we had outstanding warrants to purchase 750,000 additional common shares and options to purchase 2,618,818 additional common shares. In addition, we had convertible notes, convertible into 43,376,000 of additional common shares. Fully diluted weighted average common shares and equivalents were withheld from the calculation as they were considered anti-dilutive.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Research and Development&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Research and development costs incurred in association with the alternative fuels technology development (which include salaries and equipment) were expensed as incurred.&amp;nbsp; We had no amounts of research and development R&amp;amp;D during the year ended December 31, 2016 and 2015.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Segment Disclosure&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;FASB Codification Topic 280, &lt;i&gt;Segment Reporting&lt;/i&gt;, establishes standards for reporting financial and descriptive information about an enterprise&amp;#146;s reportable segments.&amp;#160; The Company has two reportable segments: Clean Energy HRS (HRS) and the legacy electronic manufacturing services division. The segments are determined based on several factors, including the nature of products and services, the nature of production processes, customer base, delivery channels and similar economic characteristics. Refer to note 1 for a description of the various product categories manufactured under each of these segments. Prior to March 31, 2016 we only had one reporting segment.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;An operating segment&apos;s performance is evaluated based on its pre-tax operating contribution, or segment income. Segment income is defined as net sales less cost of sales, and segment selling, general and administrative expenses, and does not include amortization of intangibles, stock-based compensation, other charges (income), net and interest and other, net.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Selected Financial Data&lt;/b&gt;:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Segment income and reconciliation before tax &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:20.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Clean Energy HRS &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 618,464 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Total Segment income &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 764,322 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Reconciling items &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; 2,576 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; (1,699,726)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &amp;#160;&amp;#160;December 31, 2016&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Total Assets &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:20.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Electronics Assembly &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,219,848 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:20.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;Clean Energy HRS &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,557,291 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;74%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:74.64%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.36%;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-right:none;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:10.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 2,777,139 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Share-Based Compensation&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company has adopted the use of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123R, &amp;#147;Share-Based Payment&amp;#148; (SFAS No.&amp;nbsp;123R) (now contained in FASB Codification Topic 718, &lt;i&gt;Compensation-Stock Compensation&lt;/i&gt;), which supersedes APB Opinion No. 25, &amp;#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees,&amp;#148; and its related implementation guidance and eliminates the alternative to use Opinion 25&amp;#146;s intrinsic value method of accounting that was provided in Statement 123 as originally issued. This Statement requires an entity to measure the cost of employee services received in exchange for an award of an equity instruments, which includes grants of stock options and stock warrants, based on the fair value of the award, measured at the grant date (with limited exceptions). Under this standard, the fair value of each award is estimated on the grant date, using an option-pricing model that meets certain requirements. We use the Black-Scholes option-pricing model to estimate the fair value of our equity awards, including stock options and warrants. The Black-Scholes model meets the requirements of SFAS No.&amp;nbsp;123R; however, the fair values generated may not reflect their actual fair values, as it does not consider certain factors, such as vesting requirements, employee attrition and transferability limitations. The Black-Scholes model valuation is affected by our stock price and a number of assumptions, including expected volatility, expected life, risk-free interest rate and expected dividends. We estimate the expected volatility and estimated life of our stock options at grant date based on historical volatility; however, due to the thinly traded nature of our stock, we have chosen to use an average of the annual volatility of like companies in our industry. For the &amp;#147;risk-free interest rate,&amp;#148; we use the Constant Maturity Treasury rate on 90-day government securities. The term is equal to the time until the option expires. The dividend yield is not applicable, as the Company has not paid any dividends, nor do we anticipate paying them in the foreseeable future. The fair value of our restricted stock is based on the market value of our free trading common stock, on the grant date calculated using a 20-trading-day average. At the time of grant, the share-based compensation expense is recognized in our financial statements based on awards that are ultimately expected to vest using historical employee attrition rates and the expense is reduced accordingly.&amp;nbsp; It is also adjusted to account for the restricted and thinly traded nature of the shares.&amp;nbsp; The expense is reviewed and adjusted in subsequent periods if actual attrition differs from those estimates. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We re-evaluate the assumptions used to value our share-based awards on a quarterly basis and, if changes warrant different assumptions, the share-based compensation expense could vary significantly from the amount expensed in the past. We may be required to adjust any remaining share-based compensation expense, based on any additions, cancellations or adjustments to the share-based awards. The expense is recognized over the period during which an employee is required to provide service in exchange for the award&amp;#151;the requisite service period (usually the vesting period). No compensation cost is recognized for equity instruments for which employees do not render the requisite service.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For the year ended December 31, 2016 and 2015 we had $113,347 and $85,450 respectively, in share based expense, due to the issuance of common stock.&amp;nbsp; As of December 31, 2016 we had no further non-vested expense to be recognized.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company accounts for income taxes under SFAS No. 109 (now contained in FASB Codification Topic 740-10-25, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes), which requires the asset and liability approach to accounting for income taxes.&amp;nbsp; Under this method, deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured based on differences between financial reporting and tax bases of assets and liabilities measured using enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in effect when differences are expected to reverse. As of December 31, 2016, we had a net operating loss carry-forward of approximately $(2,0489,37) and a deferred tax asset of $696,639&amp;nbsp;using the statutory rate of 34%. The deferred tax asset may be recognized in future periods, not to exceed 20 years.&amp;nbsp; However, due to the uncertainty of future events we have booked valuation allowance of $(696,639).&amp;#160; FASB ASC 740 prescribes recognition threshold and measurement attributes for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. FASB ASC 740 also provides guidance on de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure and transition.&amp;#160; At December 31, 2016 the Company had not taken any tax positions that would require disclosure under FASB ASC 740.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; style=&apos;width:100.0%;border-collapse:collapse&apos;&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;52%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:52.04%;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;center&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center&apos;&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;center&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center&apos;&gt;December 31, 2015&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;52%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:52.04%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Deferred Tax Asset&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; $&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 696,639&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; $&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Valuation Allowance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; (696.639)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; (118,732)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;52%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:52.04%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Deferred Tax Asset (Net)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-right:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; -&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.98%;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-right:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; -&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On September 15, 2015, the Company entered into a Transaction Completion and Financing Agreement&amp;#160; with ETI Partners IV LLC, and Company agreed to issue to ETI 100,910,321 shares of restricted common stock, representing 70% of the fully diluted common stock of the Company.&amp;#160; This resulted in a change in control, which limited the net operating to that date forward.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We are subject to taxation in the U.S. and the states of California and Utah. Further, the Company currently has no open tax years&amp;#146; subject to audit prior to December 31, 2013.&amp;#160; The Company is current on its federal and state tax returns.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Reclassification&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Certain amounts in the prior period financial statements have been reclassified to conform to the current period presentation. These reclassifications had no effect on reported income, total assets, or stockholders&amp;#146; equity as previously reported.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Business Combination and Goodwill&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On March 20, 2013, we completed the acquisition of Trident whereby we acquired 100% of the issued and outstanding common stock shares of Trident in exchange for 1,600,000 shares of our restricted shares of common stock. As a result of the acquisition, Trident has become a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. As a result, we recognized $420,673 in goodwill.&amp;#160; On January 2, 2016 we closed the Trident facility in Utah and as for the year ended December 31, 2015 we booked an impairment of the goodwill in the amount of $420,673.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recently Issued Accounting Standards&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;The Company is reviewing the effects of following recent updates.&amp;nbsp; The Company has no expectation that any of these items will have a material effect upon the financial statements.&lt;/p&gt; ACCOUNTS AND NOTES RECEIVABLE&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:12.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:12.0pt;margin-left:0in&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;center&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center&apos;&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;26%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:26.36%;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;background:#9CE7A9;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Accrued Interest Related party&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Accrued Payable to GE - TSA&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 972,233 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 792,868 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;48%&quot; style=&apos;width:48.16%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Accrued Rent&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 123,626 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 48,190 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;48%&quot; style=&apos;width:48.16%;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Total Accrued Expenses&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-right:none;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,773,983 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;25%&quot; style=&apos;width:25.92%;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-right:none;background:#D7FFD7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,555,780 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesDisclosureTextBlock>
	<us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='Y16'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 8 &amp;#150; NOTES PAYABLE&lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company issued a short-term note payable to an individual, secured by the assets of the Company, dated September 6, 2013 in the amount of $50,000 and fixed fee amount of $3,500. As of December 31, 2016 the outstanding balance was $38,500.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On November 11, 2013, we entered in to an accounts receivable financing agreement with American Interbanc (now Nations Interbanc).&amp;#160; Amounts outstanding under the agreement bear interest at the rate of 2.5% per month.&amp;#160; It is secured by the assets of the Company.&amp;#160; In addition, it is personally guaranteed by Kambiz Mahdi, our Chief Executive Officer. As of December 31, 2016, the outstanding balance was $790,959 compared to $786,227 at December 31, 2015. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On November 3, 2009, the Company issued an unsecured note payable to Linwood Goddard at a 12.00% interest rate, with a 36-month amortization and monthly payments of $334.14.&amp;nbsp; At March 31, 2016, the outstanding balance was $4,332. On May 13, 2016 the remaining principal balance of this note and accrued interest were converted into common stock at $.08.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On December 24, 2009, the Company issued an unsecured note payable to Linwood Goddard at a 12.00% interest rate, with a 36-month amortization and monthly payments of $334.14.&amp;nbsp; At March 31, 2016, the outstanding balance was $4,332.&amp;nbsp;On May 13, 2016 the remaining Principal balance of this note and accrued interest were converted into common stock at $.08&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On August 28, 2014, we issued an unsecured note for $100,000 with a fixed fee of $20,000, amortized over 7 months.&amp;#160; On December 22, 2014, the outstanding balance of this note including remaining fees was $58,441, when the outstanding balance was rolled into a new note in the initial principal amount of $150,000, with fees in the amount of $28,500.&amp;#160; The new note amortizes over 18 months.&amp;#160; The outstanding balance at December 31, 2016 was $7,388.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On September 11, 2015, our CE HRS subsidiary issued a promissory note in the initial principal amount $1,400,000 and assumed a pension liability of $100,000, for a total liability of $1,500,000, in connection with our acquisition of the heat recovery solutions, or HRS, assets of General Electric International, Inc., a Delaware corporation (&amp;#147;GEII&amp;#148;), including intellectual property, patents, trademarks, machinery, equipment, tooling and fixtures.&amp;#160; The note bears interest at the rate of 2.66% per annum.&amp;#160; The note is payable on the following schedule: (a) $200,000 in principal on December 31, 2015 and (b) thereafter, the remaining principal amount of $1,200,000, together with interest thereon, payable in equal quarterly installments of principal and interest of $157,609.02, commencing on December 31, 2016 and continuing until December 31, 2018, at which time the remaining unpaid principal amount of this note and all accrued and unpaid interest thereon shall be due and payable in full. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;Convertible notes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;On March 15, 2016, we entered into a three-year convertible note payable in the initial face amount of $75,000, which accrues interest at the rate of 1.46% per annum.&amp;#160; It was not convertible until six months after its issuance and has a conversion rate of sixty five percent (65%) of the lowest closing bid price (as reported by Bloomberg LP) of common stock for the twenty (20) Trading Days immediately preceding the date of the date of conversion.&amp;#160; On September 15, 2016 we issued shares at a price of $.006 per share for a partial conversion of this note in the amount of $15,000.&amp;#160; On November 1, 2016 the Company exercised its right to redeem the note, assigned its redemption right to a third-party investor, agreed to amend the conversion price of a replacement note to $.005 per share, and that investor now holds the replacement note in the principal amount of $84,000.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On June 6, 2016, we entered into a one-year convertible note payable for $87,500, which accrues interest at the rate of 12% per annum.&amp;#160; It is not convertible until six months after its issuance and has a conversion rate of fifty-five percent (55%) of the lowest closing bid price (as reported by Bloomberg LP) of our common stock for the twenty (20) Trading Days immediately preceding the date of conversion. On December 16, 2016 we issued 1,200,000 shares of common stock at $.0031 for a partial conversion of this note in the amount of $3,696.&amp;#160; Subsequently on January 4, we issued 2,300,000 shares of common stock at $.002192 for a partial conversion of this note in the amount of $5,042.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On June 15, 2016, Meddy Sahebi, Chairman of our Board of Directors, advanced the Company $5,000. &amp;#160;There were no specified terms for repayment of this loan other than that it was to be repaid within a reasonable time.&amp;#160; As of December 31, 2016 the outstanding balance was $5,000.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On July 6, 2016, we entered into a six-month convertible note payable for $77,500, which accrues interest at the rate of 10% per annum.&amp;#160; It is not convertible until six months after its issuance and has a conversion rate of fifty-five percent (55%) of the lowest closing bid price (as reported by Bloomberg LP) of our common stock for the twenty (20) Trading Days immediately preceding the date of conversion.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On August 12, 2016, we entered into a six-month convertible note payable for $57,000, which accrues interest at the rate of 12% per annum.&amp;#160; It is not convertible until six months after its issuance and has a conversion rate of fifty-five percent (55%) of the lowest closing bid price (as reported by Bloomberg LP) of our common stock for the twenty (20) Trading Days immediately preceding the date of conversion.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;On November 2, 2016, we effected the repayment of the convertible note dated March 15, 2016 for an aggregate amount of $84,000.&amp;#160; Concurrently, we entered into an Escrow Funding Agreement with Red Dot Investment, Inc., a California corporation (&amp;#147;Reddot&amp;#148;), pursuant to which Reddot deposited funds into escrow to fund the repayment and we assigned to Reddot our right to acquire the convertible note and Reddot acquired the convertible note.&amp;#160; Concurrently, we and Reddot amended the convertible note (a) to have a fixed conversion price of $.005 per share, subject to potential further adjustment in the event of certain Common Stock issuances, (b) to have a fixed interest rate of ten percent (10%) per annum with respect to both the redemption amount and including a financing fee and any costs, expenses, or other fees relating to the convertible note or its enforcement and collection, and any other expense for or on our account (in each case with a minimum 10% yield in the event of payoff or conversion within the first year), such amounts to constitute additional principal under the convertible note, as amended, and (c) as otherwise provided in the Escrow Funding Agreement.&amp;#160; The March 2016 convertible note, as so amended, is referred to as the &amp;#147;Master Note.&amp;#148;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;On January 9, 2017, we effected the partial repayment of the convertible note dated July 6, 2016.&amp;#160; The holder had elected to convert $15,400 ($11,544.45 in principal and $3.855.55 in accrued interest) into a total of 7,000,000 shares of Common Stock.&amp;#160; The conversion left $66,205.55 remaining due and payable under the July 2016 convertible note and we paid the note holder a total of $89,401.98 in repayment.&amp;#160; On January 12, 2017, we effected the partial repayment of the convertible note dated June 6, 2016.&amp;#160; The holder had elected to retain $26,117.77 (consisting of $24,228.72 in principal and $1,899.05 in interest), leaving $60,941.49 remaining due and payable under the June 2016 convertible note, which was satisfied and canceled in consideration of the payment to the note holder of $97,506.38.&amp;#160; On January 9, 2017, we effected the repayment in full of the convertible note dated August 12, 2016 through payment to the note holder of a total of $89,401.98.&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;Concurrently with the foregoing note repayments, we entered into a Credit Agreement and Promissory Note (the &amp;#147;Credit Agreement&amp;#148;) with Megawell USA Technology Investment Fund I LLC, a Wyoming limited liability company in formation (&amp;#147;MW I&amp;#148;), pursuant to which MW I deposited funds into escrow to fund the repayment of the convertible notes and we assigned to MW I our right to acquire the convertible notes and otherwise agreed that MW I would be subrogated to the rights of each note holder to the extent a note was repaid with funds advanced by MW I.&amp;#160; Concurrently, MW I acquired the Master Note and we agreed that all amounts advanced by MG I to or for our benefit would be governed by the terms of the Master Note, including the payment of a financing fees, interest, minimum interest, and convertibility. Reddot is MW I&amp;#146;s agent for purposes of administration of the Credit Agreement and the Master Note and advances thereunder.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;X-NONE&quot;&gt;The foregoing summary descriptions of the Escrow Funding Agreement (including amendments to the Master Note), the Settlement Agreement, and the Credit Agreement are not complete and are qualified in their entirety by reference to the full texts thereof, copies of which were included as Exhibits 10.02 to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated October 31, 2016 and to Exhibits 10.01 and 10.02 to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated January 4, 2016.&amp;#160; The foregoing summary description of the original Master Note is not complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text thereof, a copy of which was included as Exhibit 10.03 to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated October 31, 2016.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 9 &amp;#150; Derivative Liabilities&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt&apos;&gt;On March 11, 2016, we entered into a 3-year convertible note payable with Peak One Investments for $75,000, which accrues interest at the rate of 1.46% per annum. It was not convertible for 6 months and had a conversion rate of sixty five percent (65%) of the lowest closing bid price (as reported by Bloomberg LP) of Common Stock for the twenty (20) Trading Days immediately preceding the date of the date of conversion.&amp;#160; On September 15, 2016 we issued shares @ $.006 for a partial conversion of this note in the amount of $15,000.&amp;#160; Subsequently on October 31, 2016 the balance of this note was paid in full.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; style=&apos;width:100.0%;border-collapse:collapse&apos;&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;52%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:52.8%;background:#B7FFB7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;23%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:23.0%;background:#B7FFB7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;center&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center&apos;&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;24%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:24.2%;background:#B7FFB7;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;center&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center&apos;&gt;December&amp;#160; The facility is approximately 15,040 square feet and located at 440 West Lawndale Drive, Salt Lake City UT 84115.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;In April 2015, Trident entered into a sublease agreement for the facility with Lucky Spoon, LLC. The term of the sublease commenced on April 1, 2015 and expires on the last day of Trident&amp;#146;s lease. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On August 27, 2015, we entered into a sublease agreement with Rosenson Properties, LLC, a California limited liability company, as landlord, and General Electric International, Inc., a Delaware corporation, as tenant and assignor, for the premises located at 150 Baker Street East, Costa Mesa, California.&amp;#160; GEII had entered into a lease dated as of December 17, 2010, as amended by a First Amendment to Lease dated March 11, 2014, wherein Rosenson Properties leased the premises to GEII.&amp;#160; The premises consist of approximately 35,704 square feet of space and the lease provides for monthly triple-net lease payments of $22,973.&amp;#160; The lease term ended on December 31, 2016.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On March 10, 2016, we signed a lease agreement for a 18,200 square-foot CTU Industrial Building at 2990 Redhill Unit A, Costa Mesa, CA.&amp;#160; On May 1, 2016 we moved out of the Baker Street facility and moved our operations and headquarters to the new facility.&amp;#160; The lease term at the new facility is seven years and two months beginning October 1, 2016.&amp;#160;
